title: The Gossip
situation: You overhear your friend talking bad about another classmate. They laugh and ask you what you think about that person.
choices: Laugh along so you don't seem awkward.
Change the subject and avoid talking about anyone.
Say, “I don’t think it’s right to talk about others like that.”
response: Jesus teaches us to treat others how we want to be treated. He wouldn’t join in on gossip.
verse: Luke 6:31 - “Do to others as you would have them do to you.”

title: The Left-Out Kid
situation: There’s a new student at school who sits alone at lunch. Your friends ignore them.
choices: Sit with them and try to make them feel welcome.
Smile from a distance but stay with your friends.
Let the teacher handle it.
response: Jesus always reached out to the lonely and made people feel seen.
verse: Romans 15:7 - “Accept one another, then, just as Christ accepted you.”

title: The Lost Game
situation: You lose in a big game and feel like blaming your teammate.
choices: Blame your teammate loudly so others agree.
Take a breath and let it go.
Talk to your teammate privately and express your feelings kindly.
response: Jesus teaches us to handle conflict with love and self-control.
verse: James 1:19 - “Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry.”

title: The Cheat Sheet
situation: A friend offers you the answers to tomorrow’s test.
choices: Say yes but promise not to do it again.
Say no and let your teacher know what’s going on.
Say no and study hard instead.
response: Jesus wants us to be honest and faithful in the small things.
verse: Luke 16:10 - “Whoever can be trusted with very little can also be trusted with much.”

title: The Sibling Fight
situation: Your younger sibling breaks your favorite thing. You're furious.
choices: Yell at them and slam the door.
Walk away and stay mad for the rest of the day.
Take time to calm down, then forgive them.
response: Jesus teaches forgiveness, even when we’re hurt.
verse: Luke 6:37 - “Forgive, and you will be forgiven.”

title: The Honest Mistake
situation: You accidentally break something at school and no one saw you.
choices: Say nothing and hope no one notices.
Tell your teacher the truth and take responsibility.
Blame someone else to avoid trouble.
response: Jesus is proud when we tell the truth and own our mistakes.
verse: Proverbs 12:22 - “The Lord delights in people who are trustworthy.”

title: The Unpopular Kid
situation: Your friends tease a kid who doesn’t dress like everyone else.
choices: Tell your friends to stop and be kind.
Stay silent and pretend not to notice.
Laugh just a little so they don’t turn on you.
response: Jesus stood up for people who were left out or different.
verse: Proverbs 31:8 - “Speak up for those who cannot speak for themselves.”
